324b4d44-55e9-4e06-8dd6-20b46a245043.description: This degree is delivered by the Centre for Customs and Excise Studies (CCES) through Charles Sturt University. It equips students with fundamental knowledge and skills in the field of customs and border management. The course has been designed by CCES in collaboration with industry, government and international agencies, as is accredited by the World Customs Organization as meeting the requirements of the Customs profession.
324b4d44-55e9-4e06-8dd6-20b46a245043.name: Bachelor of Border Management

issuer.summary: issued by Centre for Customs & Excise Studies

alignments.name: AQF Level 7 – Bachelor Degree
alignments.description: The purpose of the Bachelor Degree qualification type is to qualify individuals who apply a broad and coherent body of knowledge in a range of contexts to undertake professional work and as a pathway for further learning. Bachelor Degree qualifications are located at level 7 of the Australian Qualifications Framework.

alignments.name: WCO Professional Standards
alignments.description: The Standards represent a framework against which Customs-related academic programmes can be designed and formally recognized by the WCO in accordance with the WCO Recognition Guidelines.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the ten core subjects totalling 128 credit points as well as an additional 64 points in elective subjects, passing all subjects with at least 50% grading.

c112da54-5de8-4bad-98e0-c2196bafbf37.description: This degree is delivered by the Centre for Customs and Excise Studies (CCES) through Charles Sturt University. Students gain a sound knowledge of international customs policy and practice including key international instruments affecting customs operations and regulatory practices. Students learn to apply their knowledge and skills to a diverse range of problems faced by border administrations and other organisations involved in cross-border trade.
c112da54-5de8-4bad-98e0-c2196bafbf37.name: Graduate Diploma of Customs Administration

issuer.summary: issued by Centre for Customs & Excise Studies

alignments.name: AQF Level 8 criteria for the Graduate Diploma
alignments.description: The purpose of the Graduate Diploma qualification type is to qualify individuals who apply a body of knowledge in a range of contexts to undertake professional or highly skilled work and as a pathway for further learning.

alignments.name: WCO Professional Standards
alignments.description: The Standards represent a framework against which Customs-related academic programmes can be designed and formally recognized by the WCO in accordance with the WCO Recognition Guidelines.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the two core subjects totalling 32 credit points as well as an additional 32 credit points in elective subjects, passing all subjects with at least 50% grading.

5633d41c-195e-4fe9-a3d6-d9ac6e927916.description: This degree is delivered by the Centre for Customs and Excise Studies (CCES) through Charles Sturt University. Students study strategic and operational management issues in customs, international trends impacting customs and cross-border trade, and international best practice. The course has been designed by CCES in collaboration with industry, government and international agencies, as is accredited by the WCO as meeting the requirements of the Customs profession.
5633d41c-195e-4fe9-a3d6-d9ac6e927916.name: Master of Customs Administration

issuer.summary: issued by Centre for Customs & Excise Studies

alignments.name: AQF Level 9 – Masters Degree
alignments.description: The purpose of the Masters Degree (Coursework) is to qualify individuals who apply an advanced body of knowledge in a range of contexts for professional practice or scholarship and as a pathway for further learning.

alignments.name: WCO Professional Standards
alignments.description: The Standards represent a framework against which Customs-related academic programmes can be designed and formally recognized by the WCO in accordance with the WCO Recognition Guidelines.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the two core subjects totalling 56 credit points as well as an additional 40 credit points in elective subjects, passing all subjects with at least 50% grading.

bd0a8744-07b1-4ee1-ae7c-f77daf781e22.description: This degree is delivered by the Centre for Customs and Excise Studies (CCES) through Charles Sturt University. The course prepares students to effectively apply complex policy in the cross-border trading environment, and to exercise advanced skills in judgement, adaptability and responsibility as a practitioner dealing with, or working in, customs administrations.
bd0a8744-07b1-4ee1-ae7c-f77daf781e22.name: Graduate Certificate in Customs Administration

issuer.summary: issued by Centre for Customs & Excise Studies

alignments.name: AQF Level 8 criteria for the Graduate Certificate
alignments.description: The purpose of the Graduate Certificate qualification type is to qualify individuals who apply a body of knowledge in a range of contexts to undertake professional or highly skilled work and as a pathway for further learning. Graduate Certificate qualifications are located at level 8 of the Australian Qualifications Framework.

alignments.name: WCO Professional Standards
alignments.description: The Standards represent a framework against which Customs-related academic programmes can be designed and formally recognized by the WCO in accordance with the WCO Recognition Guidelines.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the two core subjects totalling 32 credit points, passing both subjects with at least 50% grading.
